name: container-diet
description: Slim down your Docker images with the power of AI. Container Diet analyzes your images and Dockerfiles to provide actionable, context-aware optimization advice.
readme_summary: Container Diet is an AI-powered CLI tool that analyzes Docker images and Dockerfiles to provide actionable optimization advice. It helps users reduce image size, improve security, and adhere to best practices with a fun,
key_features: Security vulnerability detection (root user, secrets, packages)
primary_use_case: Optimizing Docker images for size, security, and best practices using AI-generated advice.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, anthropomorphic ship's captain, embodying the 'Container Dietician', standing on the deck of a large, bloated cargo ship that is visibly overflowing with unnecessary 'bytes' represented as colorful, oversized packages. The captain is holding a magnifying glass to a blueprint of the ship (representing a Dockerfile) and pointing with a stern but friendly expression towards a smaller, sleek, and efficient cargo ship docked nearby. Digital particles representing optimization suggestions flow from the captain's magnifying glass towards the bloated ship. The background is a stylized, clean ocean under a bright, clear sky. The overall style is a vibrant 3D isometric illustration with clear iconography and a playful, helpful mood, subtly incorporating the 'Container Diet' name on the captain's hat.

name: bj_led
description: Home Assistant custom integration for BJ_LED devices
readme_summary: This repository provides a custom Home Assistant integration for controlling BJ_LED devices, which are inexpensive Bluetooth LE-enabled LED strips. It allows users to manage power, color, and basic modes of these lights directly from their Home Assistant dashboard.
key_features: Home Assistant custom integration for BJ_LED devices
Support for fancy color modes (without speed control)
primary_use_case: Integrating inexpensive Bluetooth LE LED strips (BJ_LED/MohuanLED) into Home Assistant for smart home automation.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized robot assistant in a cozy living room, holding a remote control that is wirelessly connected to a colorful LED strip light. The robot is shown adjusting the light's color and brightness, with subtle digital data streams flowing from the remote to the light. Small, glowing icons representing 'On/Off', 'Color Wheel', and 'Mode' float around the scene. The overall mood is warm and inviting, emphasizing seamless smart home control. The art style should be a clean, 3D isometric illustration with a soft color palette, clearly depicting the integration of a simple smart device into a home environment. The repository name 'BJ_LED' is subtly integrated into the robot's design or a small label on the remote.

name: audioghost-ai
description: Extract any sound with text prompts. Memory-optimized SAM-Audio with modern UI.
readme_summary: AudioGhost AI is a desktop application that uses AI to separate or extract specific sounds from audio or video files based on natural language descriptions. It leverages a memory-optimized version of Meta's SAM-Audio model and provides a modern user interface with real-time progress and audio mixing capabilities.
key_features: Stem Mixer for preview and comparison
primary_use_case: Extracting specific sounds (e.g., vocals, instruments, background noise) from audio or video files using natural language prompts.
cover_image_prompt: A sound engineer, depicted as a conductor, stands before a complex audio mixing board. Instead of musical notes, glowing text prompts like 'vocals', 'drums', and 'dog barking' float in the air. The conductor uses a magical baton to precisely isolate these sounds, which are represented as distinct, colorful energy streams flowing from a central audio waveform into separate containers. Residual noise is shown as a faint, dissipating mist. Subtle UI elements of the AudioGhost application are visible on a nearby screen, displaying progress bars and stem controls. The scene is set in a futuristic, minimalist studio with soft, ethereal lighting, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a clean, vibrant color palette.

name: telegraph-parser
readme_summary: This Python repository provides an asynchronous parser for Telegra.ph articles. It allows users to fetch article content from Telegra.ph URLs, making it useful for applications that need to extract and process information from this platform.
key_features: Handles Telegra.ph URL formats including ordinal numbers for duplicate titles
primary_use_case: Extracting and processing article content from Telegra.ph URLs asynchronously.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian character is shown in a cozy, old-fashioned library, meticulously extracting text from a stack of vintage telegraph slips. Each slip represents a Telegra.ph article, and the librarian is carefully transcribing the content onto a modern, glowing digital tablet. Subtle digital particles flow from the slips to the tablet, indicating data transfer. In the background, a small, stylized screen displays a simplified code snippet and the repository name 'telegraph-parser' integrated into a bookshelf. The scene is illuminated by a warm, inviting light, emphasizing the transformation of old-fashioned communication into digital information. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with clean lines and a focus on clarity.

name: jumpserver
description: JumpServer is an open-source Privileged Access Management (PAM) platform that provides DevOps and IT teams with on-demand and secure access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database and RemoteApp endpoints through a web browser.
readme_summary: JumpServer is an open-source Privileged Access Management (PAM) platform that provides secure, on-demand access to various endpoints like SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, and databases through a web browser. It's designed for DevOps and IT teams to manage privileged access efficiently and securely.
key_features: Secure access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database, and RemoteApp endpoints
primary_use_case: To provide a centralized, secure, and auditable platform for managing privileged access to IT infrastructure for DevOps and IT teams.
cover_image_prompt: A digital librarian meticulously organizing and granting access to a vast, glowing library of servers and databases, represented as ancient tomes and intricate vaults. The librarian, holding a secure digital key, allows authorized users (depicted as diverse IT professionals) to briefly borrow specific 'books' or access 'vaults' via a sleek, futuristic web interface projected in the air. Subtle glowing lines connect the librarian to the resources, indicating secure, temporary access. The scene is set in a clean, modern data center with soft, ambient lighting, emphasizing security and order. The JumpServer logo is subtly integrated into the librarian's desk. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear iconography and a professional, secure aesthetic.

name: CamXploit
description: Find, analyze, and check for exposed IP cameras with open ports, known vulnerabilities, and weak login credentials.
readme_summary: CamXploit is a Python-based reconnaissance tool designed to identify exposed IP cameras on the internet. It scans common ports, detects login pages, tests default credentials, and provides detailed information about camera brands and potential vulnerabilities.
key_features: Checks if the device is a camera stream
Tests for default credentials on login pages
Provides manual search links (Shodan, Censys, Zoomeye, Google Dorking)
Enhanced Camera Detection with detailed port analysis and brand identification
Live Stream Detection for RTSP, RTMP, HTTP, and MMS protocols
Comprehensive IP & Location Information with Google Maps/Earth links
Detailed Camera Brand Detection (Hikvision, Dahua, Axis, Sony, Bosch, Samsung, Panasonic, Vivotek, CP Plus)
primary_use_case: Security research and reconnaissance to identify and analyze exposed IP cameras.
cover_image_prompt: A digital detective, depicted as a stylized magnifying glass with a glowing lens, is scanning a network of interconnected pipes. Some pipes are clearly labeled 'CCTV' and have small, blinking red lights indicating vulnerability. The detective's lens highlights these vulnerable pipes, revealing faint outlines of camera lenses within them. Subtle digital particles flow from the magnifying glass, representing the scanning process. In the background, a world map with glowing IP address markers suggests the global reach of the scan. The overall mood is one of vigilant discovery, with a clean, modern aesthetic and a color palette of blues, greens, and subtle reds. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with clear iconography and a focus on visual metaphor.
